alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 12:35PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Strong outflow winds will impact portions of southeastern Albany County through 115 PM MDT... At 1234 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking thunderstorms with strong outflow winds along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Rock River to 10 miles southwest of Bosler to near Hutton Lake to 8 miles east of Woods Landing. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Laramie, Tie City Campground, Bosler, Baldy Peak, Tie Siding, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, The Buttes, Hutton Lake and Yellow Pine Campground. This includes Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 297 and 328. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Laramie Valley; North Snowy Range Foothills; Snowy Range; South Laramie Range
